text: Is there a way to resolve overlapping dependencies on libraries between environment and what a package wants to install?

elements.text: Is there a way to resolve overlapping dependencies on libraries between environment and what a package wants to install?

text: Specifically, I’m having an issue with Qt5 from a python repo used via PyPlot and the Qt5Base that GR wants in plots.

elements.text: Specifically, I’m having an issue with Qt5 from a python repo used via PyPlot and the Qt5Base that GR wants in plots.

text:
```objc[82767]: Class QMacAutoReleasePoolTracker is implemented in both /Users/cmcbride/.julia/artifacts/ee74d003b12e6dd5f748e8cefb1688edbdfb184b/lib/QtCore.framework/Versions/5/QtCore (0x137b609b8) and /Users/cmcbride/.pyenv/versions/3.8.7/lib/python3.8/site-packages/PyQt5/Qt5/lib/QtCore.framework/Versions/5/QtCore (0x15d6f3198). One of the two will be used. Which one is undefined.

One of the two will be used. Which one is undefined.

One of the two will be used. Which one is undefined.

Plots.PyPlotBackend()```
